statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: USC 81, UC Riverside 48
article.story: LOS ANGELES (AP) -- Lodrick Stewart scored 23 points and Nick Young added 21 points to lead USC to a 81-48 win over UC Riverside on Wednesday night at the Sports Arena. RouSean Cromwell added four blocked shots for the Trojans (3-2), who made 11 steals and shot 57.6 percent in winning their third consecutive game. "Our basketball team needs to learn in all areas," USC coach Tim Floyd said. "We're going to have to continue to get better because we still have a long way to go." David Misko scored nine points for the Highlanders (0-4), who shot 33.3 percent and committed 24 turnovers. Larry Cunningham and Joey Knox added eight points apiece. "We're just searching for the right formula, for the right group of kids," Riverside coach David Spencer said. "Until these kids decide that basketball on our level is simply about winning and nothing else, we won't be what I'd like us to be." Both teams were tied at 10 when Stewart scored six points in a 9-0 spurt that put USC ahead 19-10 with 11:27 left in the first half. Riverside narrowed the deficit to 19-14, but the Trojans scored the next 21 points to build a 40-14 advantage with 3:28 left in the half. Young scored nine points and Stewart added eight during that run, as the Highlanders failed to score for a span of 7:23. The Trojans also held Riverside without a point for 5:03 during the second half.
